content:
A silly newbie question, how do I know if my PR will be successfully merged into Mathlib? For instance, I have a simple PR #23986.

My PR seems to be working fine. However, from what I understand, a PR usually needs to be approved by multiple reviewers before it can merged into the main branch. But I don't see an indicator on th PR page, like (0 / n), for the number of completed reviews. Does anyone know what the current situation is after the PR process was updated?
You need a single review from a maintainer

There isn't a required number of reviewers on a PR (other than it should be at least one), so there's no particular indicator you should be looking for. You may have already seen our page on "the lifecycle of a PR", but basically after someone has approved the PR, a maintainer needs to get around to merging it.

Note that we welcome reviews from everyone, so feel free to review other PRs if you have time, and that will help lighten the review load (and potentially shorten the amount of time before your PR is merged!).
Any reviews before that are just trying to get your changes in the best shape possible before a maintainer gets to it
